articles.content:
A new study has found that cancer cells can disrupt a metabolic pathway that breaks down fats and proteins to boost the levels of a byproduct called methylmalonic acid, thereby driving metastasis.

articles.author: Solen Le Net
articles.title: Lack of sleep may play 'causal' role in onset of diabetes - are you at 'particular risk'? - Express
articles.description: THE GROWING prevalence of diabetes has stirred concerns over the future welfare of millions. Tackling the crisis would require lowering obesity rates, which are also growing to pandemic proportions. According to recent findings, another factor shown to play a…
